contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=February 2011}} '''Ilinka Mitreva''' ({{lang-mk|Илинка Митрева}}) (born 1950 in [[Skopje]]) is a former [[foreign minister]] of the [[Republic of Macedonia]]. She was first appointed to that position in May 2001, but resigned in November 2001. However, she was reappointed in November 2002,<ref name="colum1">[http://www.worldleaders.columbia.edu/participants/ilinka-mitreva Ilinka Mitreva], Columbia University World Leaders Forum, Retrieved February 15, 2011</ref> and held the position until August 2006, when a new government took office after parliamentary elections.<ref name="leaving">(18 August 2006). [http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=NewsLibrary&p_multi=BBAB&d_place=BBAB&p_theme=newslibrary2&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&p_topdoc=1&p_text_direct-0=1139686E0B234D98&p_field_direct-0=document_id&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&s_trackval=GooglePM Gruevski "shocked" public, party members with minister nominees], BBC Monitoring International Reports (from Makedonija Denes) ("[[Antonio Milošoski|Antonio Milososki]], who should be [outgoing Foreign Minister] Ilinka Mitreva's successor, does not have a single day of work experience in diplomacy.")</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Mitreva, Ilinka | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Macedonian politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1950 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mitreva, Ilinka}} [[Category:1950 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Skopje]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Republic of Macedonia]] [[Category:Female foreign ministers]] [[Category:Macedonian women in politics]] [[Category:Social Democratic Union of Macedonia politicians]] {{Macedonia-politician-stub}}
